climbs.name: Wine Belly
climbs.fa: Angel Mangual, Ben Smith and Dave Evan

content.description: It will follow a slabby sandstone section to a bulge (The Belly).  Here is the start of the crux moving slightly right and back to some balancy face climbing.   You will continue until you get beneath a roof with some cool featured holds to climb up off it.
content.protection: bolts and two bolted anchors with carabiners

climbs.name: Vino Tinto
climbs.fa: FA: Erica, Ben and Angel Mangual

content.description: The route is located in an alcove on the left side of the wall.  It follows a good looking orange red rock wall.  Be ready to use some ninja stemming moves here.  The whole entire route is a stemming fest to the anchors.  The hardest part will be between the 2 and fourth bolt.
content.protection: 10 bolt with and two bolted anchors with carabiners.

content.description: Awesome vertical climbing with great balance movement, smalls and long reaches.  This is a great warmup for this area as it gets in the shade very early in the day.  Finishes at the same anchor as Saluds
content.protection: 9 bolts and shares anchors with Salud

climbs.name: Sangría Olé
climbs.fa: Angel Mangual, Ben Smith and Andrea

content.description: It gradually gets harder with a good combination of climbing moves ingredients that will remind you of Great Refreshing Sangria.  It starts with some tricky easy move towards a bulge.   From here you will need to do a combination of side pull, hugging and face climbing to get to the top.  This mellow route is not over until is over.
content.protection: 8 bolts and two bolted anchors with carabineer s

content.description: Wanders through low angle face to a bulge, with increasingly thoughtful moves, and continuing up through easing face.  The hardest part is getting established below the bulge.
content.protection: 8 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with carabiners

content.description: It starts with some crimpy and balancy moves.  It has a crux on the second to third bolts that consist on some sloppy and dynamic moves.   It continues on the left side of the first roof and finishes on a nice mellow second roof climb.
content.protection: 8 bolt and bolted anchors with carabiners

content.description: The routes starts with some cool balancy moves towards a roof.  Is here where the fun starts. For you to obtain the fruits of your labor you will need to get all up in it and come out victorious.   Above the roof there is a slabby easy section but a little spicy.
content.protection: Bolts.  There is a permanent draw on the roof and two bolted anchors with carabiners.

content.description: This route follows a crack system on the far end of the wall.  It is a little grainy but good.  This route will take you to the top of the wall.   It shares route anchors with Bottle Me Whine
content.protection: single rack to a two bolt anchors.
content.location: Right of Bottle Me Whines.  The right most route on the wall.

content.description: Like a good "aguardiente" brandy, this route will put your forearms on fire and get you dreaming about España.  It has a good number of reachy and dynamic moves on good pockets followed by cruxy technical climbing that will test your stamina and your precision.  The lower section is still a bit sandy/flaky, but it will clean in time. The rest of the rock is absolutely perfect.
content.protection: 8 Bolt and with two bolt anchors

content.description: It has a good sequential roof.  When you figure out the sequence keep it going because is not done yet.   You will have a good rest and will continue slightly left with a good layback ending.  Once you are done you be left with a fear of running out of wine ;-)
content.protection: Approximately 8 bolts and 2 bolted anchors with carabiners

climbs.name: Nice Chianti
climbs.fa: Angel Mangual, Erica and Ben Smith

content.description: The crux will eat your fingers with "some fava beans and a NICE CHIANTI".   It starts on a ledge left of Vino Tinto.  It has some trickery that once you find the move and holds it will be satisfying.  The crux is halfway up the route going up the roof.  After pulling the roof, there are a some hidden holds and side pulls with some cool moves. Enjoy your Chianti, Bon Appetit!
content.protection: 9 bolts with two bolted anchors with carabiners.
content.location: This route is on the face arrete left of the Vineyard Wall.    It starts on the ledge left of Vino Tinto.

content.description: Mamma will like a drink after this one! It starts on some balancy and dynamic moves towards the right side of the first roof.  The roof is very technical and crimpy followed by a slabby section.  The second roof has some techy side pulls to a jug.
content.protection: 8 bolts and 2 bolted anchors with carabiners.
content.location: Between Pop My Cork and Bottle Me Whines

content.description: Very moderate route that just keeps going.  It is consistent with the rating with two cruxes.   This is a perfect warmup route.  It will get your blood pumping.
content.protection: 11 bolts and two bolt anchors with carabiners
content.location: It is located immediately right of Salud.

climbs.name: Hangover and Over
climbs.fa: FA: Greg Kay Eqpt: Luis Cisnero

content.description: It starts with some sloppy ledges and crimpers to a nice jug to gain your composure.  Here you will need to decide which way to go but both ways will take you to the next bolt.  It continues slightly left of the bolt and up to the chain.  Once done it will leave you hangover and over.  Symptom:    Fatigue and weakness; Excessive thirst and dry mouth; Headaches and muscle aches.
content.protection: 7 bolts and 2 bolted anchors with carabiners

content.description: This route is not very long, but you better have your pzaaaahs ready.  Starts out with fairly technical climbing on large cobblstone features, thought  provoking and balancy moves take you to a steep section where you will need to pull a series of power moves until you get to a crotch above a little roof.  From here move right up grey stonve and try to keep your grapes together.   The fun is not over some thin puzzling moves guard the anchors.
You cannot miss this route.  It follows a crack with some cool slopey features.  The crux is at the end passing a layback move into the face.
content.protection: Bolted route and two bolted anchors with carabiners

content.description: For being short this route is pumpy!  It starts with some slabby and sloppy section.  At the second to third bolt, there is the first tricky crux moving right up to a jug and ledge.  The route will follow some side pull crack to the top.  There is a redpoint crux from the 5th to 7th bolt.
content.protection: Bolts and two bolt anchors with carabiners.
content.location: First bolted route from right to left.

content.description: This route is always on the shade! It starts with two monkey bars holds up to a face balancy sections.  The crux is between the 4th and 6th bolts.  This section is very sequential and balancy.   When you reach the top enjoy the view.
content.protection: All bolted and two bolted anchors with carabiners.

content.description: This area is like a good wine it just gets better and better with time. It is located on the west end of the main wall. Don't let your sight deceived you. It does not look like much from afar but it is an unexpected tall and featured wall with great routes. The area is located behind private property.   The owner has allowed us to walk by his land through the wash. Let's keep it this way and respect his property by not littering or disrupting their animals.The left side of the wall is mostly shaded. The rest of the wall will be on the shade all day starting late morning (10-11 am). The rock has a little bit of all with good quality: Sandstone, cobblestone and limestone.  The bottom of some routes are grainy and flaky, but it will definitely clean up with time.  The routes on this wall ranges from 5.7-5.12. There is some roof, slab and even a cool tall chimney to climb.This is a new area so please WEAR your HELMET.
